meanings.definition: The quality or state of being sociable.
meanings.sent1: Her sociabilities shine through when she effortlessly chats with everyone at the party.
meanings.sent2: His sociabilities make him a popular figure in the community.
meanings.sent3: Despite his shyness, his sociabilities come out when he's around close friends.
meanings.sent4: The sociabilities of the town were evident in the warm welcome given to newcomers.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's sociabilities created a welcoming classroom environment for all students.

meanings.definition: The ability to interact and engage with others in a friendly and pleasant manner.
meanings.sent1: The team leader's sociabilities helped to foster a positive work environment.
meanings.sent2: Children with strong sociabilities find it easy to make new friends.
meanings.sent3: His sociabilities were put to the test when he had to mediate a disagreement between friends.
meanings.sent4: The politician's sociabilities were crucial in gaining the support of the community.
meanings.sent5: She used her sociabilities to network and build connections in her industry.
